record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, JULY 11, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, JULY 11, 2007 -- (Senate - July 10, 2007)

[Page: S8964]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, July 11; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business until 10:30 a.m., with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes, and the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the first half under the control of the majority and the final half under the control of the Republicans; that at 10:30, the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 1585, with the time until 11:30 a.m. for debate only with respect to the motion to invoke cloture on Webb amendment No. 2012, with the time equally divided and controlled between the chair and ranking member

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
